text: hi i'm rebecca from engvid comm and
today we're going to have a grammar
lesson on one of the most common texas
where people make sticks and that is the
simple past tense I know there are a lot
of tenses in English and it's not always
easy to keep track of them but
surprisingly the simple past tense is
the tense that we use most often usually
we don't talk about what's happening now
or what happened what's going to happen
in the future usually we talk about what
somebody did so you use the past tense
much more often than you actually
realize now when you use the past tense
of course there are three ways in which
you'll be using it right you use it to
use in a positive sentence you use it in
a negative sentence and you use it in a
question so let's go over this because
the focus of our lesson today is
specifically on how to ask questions in
the past tense because what I have
realized is that most students have more
difficulty with the questions than with
any other aspect of English so let's
focus just on that ok so let's start
with an example the example is he worked
yesterday right
he worked yesterday past tense sentence
correct in the it's a positive sentence
now let's take this sentence he worked
yesterday and make it negative what
would it be
he didn't work yesterday
correct he didn't work yesterday didn't
of course is a contraction for the words
did not now let's come to what we are
going to be studying today which is the
question form of that sentence so what
would be the question form if the
positive sense
is he worked yesterday the negative
sentences he didn't work yesterday the
question will be this one did he work
yesterday right now what happens is that
many students have a problem with the
word did they either forget to use it or
they're using it in the wrong way and
then what happens is that people start
saying things like you worked yesterday
he worked yesterday he work and all
kinds of combinations when actually you
have to do is remember to use the word
did it is really important in the past
tense because without did it's really
hard to ask any questions correctly so
you need to use the word did then you
put the subject and last you put the
verb in the base form the base form
means the regular form of the verb all
right so we have did he work yesterday
right you can see that the verb has come
back we don't say did he worked
we don't say he worked we say did he
work all right let's let take another
example so let's take another sentence
first and run it through all three forms
so the sentence was let's say you went
to the party yesterday you went to the
party yesterday
how will you make it negative you didn't
go to the party and the question is did
you go all right did you go let's take
another one she finished her homework
negative she didn't finish her homework
question did
she finish her homework okay good
let's take another example they clean
the room they cleaned the room is the
positive sentence what's the negative of
that they didn't clean the room and the
question forum will be did they clean
the room right did they keep all right
so that's the most important thing that
we need to remember that it's really
quite simple to ask questions in the
past tense however if you are forgetting
to use the word did then most likely you
are making a mistake so just put this
word in and it will make things a lot
easier
now the other thing I wanted to point
out to you is that all the words you see
here can be used before this
construction so you could say what did
you do yesterday or where did you go
yesterday when did you go how did you go
right who did you go with how much did
you pay how long did you stay all right
so what do you see with all of these
question words right you're putting them
in this
before did and the rest of the sentence
stays exactly the same
the rest of the questions are alright so
you can put these conveniently right
before the word did the same with
certain expressions that we use what
color what color dress did you buy okay
so what color did you buy or what size
did you buy what kind of book do you
like what flavor ice cream did you buy
alright so you see that not only to the
question words go before did but also
these kind of expressions like what
color what size what flavor okay
and as long as you're doing that with
the word did then you're asking
questions correctly in the past tense
all right
I hope I made it a little bit easier for
you to understand this
but if you'd like to have a little more
practice which is always helpful please
visit our website wwlp.com and there
you'll find a quiz where you can
practice this a lot until you get it
right okay so all the best with that and
bye for now
thanks for watching
